DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Description Performed Observation Outcome Outcome Classification Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A characterization of the extent of any localized or abnormal change in the structure of part of an organ or tissue. The highest level of the terminology describing the result distinguished by anatomical or physiological system, etiology, or purpose. EXAMPLE(S): Blood and lymphatic system disorders; Cardiac disorders; Congenital, familial and genetic disorders; Ear and labyrinth disorders; Endocrine disorders; Eye disorders; Gastrointestinal disorders; General disorders and administration site conditions; Hepatobiliary disorders; Immune system disorders; Infections and infestations; Injury, poisoning and procedural complications; Investigations; Metabolism and nutrition disorders; Musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorders; Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps); Nervous system disorders; Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions; Psychiatric disorders; Renal and urinary disorders; Reproductive system and breast disorders; Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders; Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders; Social circumstances; Surgical and medical procedures; Vascular disorders OTHER NAME(S): System Organ Class NOTE(S): Note that the DSET data type means that more than one value can be specified for this attribute, however this is meant to be interpreted as more than one system, etiology or purpose, such as when a CRF has "check all that apply" instruction. This is not meant to imply that there would be more than one level of terminology or that some sort of hierarchy of terms would be conveyed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Description Performed Observation Outcome Outcome Classification Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._The result of an action.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
